alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior Waldo; Interior York; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Northern Oxford; Sagadahoc; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 7:18AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A line of heavy rain moving northeast will impact portions of Oxford, west central Waldo, Androscoggin, southeastern Franklin, Kennebec, northwestern Knox, north central York, Lincoln, Cumberland, Sagadahoc, southern Coos, northeastern Grafton and northern Carroll Counties through 800 AM EDT... HAZARD...Torrential rain with rainfall rates over 2 inches per hour. This will reduce visibility and could cause hydroplaning for motorists. More rain is expected throughout the day which could result in flash floods as repeating shower activity is expected. Please stay tuned to the latest warnings from the National Weather Service. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Use caution if traveling through into this drenching rainfall. Visibility will drop to under a quarter of an inch cause rapid ponding on roadways and low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Brunswick, Augusta, Westbrook, Waterville, Conway, Berlin, Bath, Gardiner, Bridgton, Lancaster, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Bethel, Bethlehem, Damariscotta, Lincoln, Naples and Oakland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 12 and 51. Interstate 93 between mile markers 86 and 114. Interstate 95 between mile markers 54 and 128. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
